snippet: New court action against the former military ruler Pervez Musharraf is the first time such a senior Pakistani Army figure has faced criminal charges.
abstract: Pakistani court indicts former Pres Pervez Musharraf in connection with 2007 assassination of former Prime Min Benazir Bhutto, in first time that senior military general has faced criminal charges; few details are provided linking Musharraf to Bhutto's death but charges are believed to rely heavily on statement by Washington lobbyist Mark Siegel, who was a friend of Bhutto's.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Salman Masood reported from Islamabad, and Declan Walsh from London.

lead_paragraph: New court action against the former military ruler Pervez Musharraf is the first time such a senior Pakistani Army figure has faced criminal charges.

headline.main: Pakistani Court Indicts Musharraf in 2007 Assassination of Bhutto
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Court Indicts Musharraf in 2007 Assassination of Bhutto
